meanings.definition: The quality or state of being comparable.
meanings.sent1: The comparablenesses of the two cars made it easy to decide which one to buy.
meanings.sent2: She studied the comparablenesses of the two paintings before choosing her favorite.
meanings.sent3: The comparablenesses of the two desserts left everyone in a dilemma.
meanings.sent4: The comparablenesses of their talents shone brightly during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of understanding the comparablenesses of different historical events.

meanings.definition: The degree to which two or more things can be compared.
meanings.sent1: The comparablenesses between the two books were evident in their themes.
meanings.sent2: He struggled to determine the comparablenesses of the two job offers.
meanings.sent3: The comparablenesses of the two jokes made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The comparablenesses of their personalities were strikingly similar.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the comparablenesses between the two theories required careful analysis.
